text: The Capitoline Temple is an ancient monument located in the old city of Volubilis in Fès-Meknès, Morocco. It dates from the Roman era, and was situated in the ancient Kingdom of Mauretania. Stone ruins of the Capitoline Temple at Volubilis The building incorporates a Romanesque tetrastyle architectural design, and was dedicated to the Roman Emperor Macrinus.C.M. Hogan, 2007 The temple is earmarked for the trinity of Roman gods, Juno, Jupiter and Minerva.B. Rogerson, 2000 According to Rogerson, a council would meet below the Capitoline Temple in order to make a declaration of war, and then later return to this location with the booty of the resultant war. The Romans also constructed temples of the same name in Ancient Rome and other locations within the Roman Empire. ==See also== *Arch of Trajan (Timgad) *Libyco-Punic Mausoleum of Dougga *Madghacen *Roman architecture ==Line notes== ==References== * C. Michael Hogan, Volubilis, The Megalithic Portal, ed. Andy Burnham (2007) * Barnaby Rogerson (2000} Marrakesh, Fez and Rabat, New Holland Publishers, 290 pages Category:Roman sites in Morocco Category:Temples of Jupiter Category:Buildings and structures in Fès-Meknès Category:Temples of Minerva Category:Temples of Juno
title: Capitoline Temple
